alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 1:09PM MDT until March 19 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Virden affecting Hidalgo County. For the Gila River...including Gila, Virden, Redrock...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Gila River Above Virden. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Sunday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 8.8 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.0 feet just after midnight tonight. High flows will continue through the weekend. Flows will decrease Sunday afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Gila River Virden 15.0 8.8 Thu 12 pm MD 9.5 9.5 8.9 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
